meanings.definition: The state of being idle or inactive.
meanings.sent1: Her idlenesses during the weekend were spent lounging on the couch.
meanings.sent2: The idlenesses of the deserted town gave it a peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: His idlenesses were so extreme that even the dust bunnies seemed more active.
meanings.sent4: The idlenesses of the old clock made it seem like time had stopped.
meanings.sent5: The idlenesses of the cat were interrupted only by occasional stretches.

meanings.sent1: The idlenesses in the office were noticeable during the slow season.
meanings.sent2: The idlenesses of the garden were a result of the drought.
meanings.sent3: The idlenesses of the computer were due to a power outage.
meanings.sent4: The idlenesses of the car engine indicated a need for repair.
meanings.sent5: The idlenesses of the playground were a sign of the approaching storm.

meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being lazy or unproductive.
meanings.sent1: His idlenesses at work led to his eventual dismissal.
meanings.sent2: The idlenesses of the student were reflected in his grades.
meanings.sent3: The idlenesses of the worker were evident in the unfinished tasks.
meanings.sent4: The idlenesses of the artist resulted in a lack of new creations.
meanings.sent5: The idlenesses of the team caused them to fall behind in the competition.
